contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=October 2011}} '''Joseph "Ziggy" Modeliste''' (born 28 December 1948<ref>{{cite web|last=Seida |first=Linda |url={{Allmusic|class=artist |id=p106595 |pure_url=yes}} |title=Ziggy Modeliste |publisher=AllMusic |date=2001-11-21 |accessdate=2011-10-22}}</ref> also known as '''Zigaboo''') is an American [[drummer]] best known as a founding member of the [[funk]] group [[The Meters]]. He also cofounded [[The Wild Tchoupitoulas]] and has worked extensively with other musicians, notably [[Keith Richards]], [[Robert Palmer (singer)|Robert Palmer]], and [[Dr. John]]. ==History== Modeliste recorded on all the original LPs with [[The Meters]] and has also been sampled many times over from artists such as Musiq, Queen Latifah, [[Run DMC]], [[N.W.A|NWA]], [[Ice Cube]], [[Salt-N-Pepa]], [[Cypress Hill]], [[EPMD]], [[Public Enemy (band)|Public Enemy]], [[Digable Planets]], [[DJ Shadow]], [[A Tribe Called Quest]], [[Beastie Boys]], [[Naughty by Nature]], and [[Tweet (singer)|Tweet]]. In 2005, he was a [[Broadcast Music Incorporated|BMI]] award winner for “Can’t Stop Won’t Stop” by Young Gunz - and also, his drum sound provided the main loops for Amerie’s “1Thing” - nominated for two [[Grammy]]s and hit #1 on the R&B charts. Modeliste has written over 400 songs individually and collectively with [[The Meters]]. This collection of songs has been released on over 36 albums nationally and internationally. His tunes have also been in movies such as “Two Can Play That Game”,"Red", “Jackie Brown”, “Drum Line”, and “8 Mile”. Modeliste released his first solo CD in 2000 - ”[[Zigaboo.com]]”. “[[I’m on the Right Track]]” was released in 2004 (with special guests [[Dr. John]] and [[Bernie Worrell]]). In 2006, he released the single "Let's Get Fired Up" described as "A Fight Song for Our Saints." In 2007, he participated in ''[[Goin' Home: A Tribute to Fats Domino]]'', contributing his version of Domino's "[[I'm Gonna Be a Wheel Someday]]", with [[Herbie Hancock]] and [[Renard Poche]]. [[Funk Me Hard Live]], a live performance from 1980 recorded in New Orleans was released in 2009. In 2011 He released his fourth solo album entitled "New Life". This record has elements of rock, funk and blues and features such artists as arranger Wardell Quezerque and Trumpeter Mic Gillet of Tower of Power fame. He resides in [[Oakland, California]] and continues to teach, release records, as well as manage his publishing Company Jomod Music and record label JZM records. In 2010 and 2011, Modeliste visited Europe to play at Scandinavian Festivals, and other special concerts with European bands. An incomplete list of other artists he has recorded for or with: * [[Dr. John]] * [[The Wild Tchoupitoulas]] * [[Allen Toussaint]] * [[Lee Dorsey]] * [[Robert Palmer (singer)|Robert Palmer]] * [[Keith Richards]] * [[Bill Laswell]] * [[Aaron Neville]] * [[Professor Longhair]] * [[John Fogerty]] * [[Harry Connick Jr.]] * [[Mark Ronson]] ==Discography== *[[:Category:The Meters albums|The Meters Discography]] *''[[Zigaboo.com]]'' (2000) JZM Records *''[[I'm On the Right Track]]'' (2004) JZM Records *''Funk Me Hard Live'' (2009) JZM Records *''New Life'' (2011) JZM Records ==References== {{Reflist}} http://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/exclusive-stream-mark-ronson-teams-with-erykah-badu-mos-def-dap-kings-20111028 http://www.zigaboo.com ==External links== *[http://www.zigaboo.com/ Official website] {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2010}} {{Authority control|VIAF=10050585}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Modeliste, Joseph, Zigaboo | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = Joseph Modeliste | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 28 December 1948 | PLACE OF BIRTH = New Orleans, LA | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Modeliste, Zigaboo}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American drummers]] [[Category:American funk musicians]] [[Category:American session musicians]] [[Category:American soul musicians]] [[Category:R&B musicians from New Orleans]] [[Category:People from Oakland, California]] [[Category:1948 births]]
